sen.j: 富田 近行（とみだ ちかゆき）は、鎌倉時代の武蔵国児玉党（現在の埼玉県本庄市富田出身）の武士。
sen.e: Chikayuki TOMIDA was a samurai who belonged to the Kodama party of Musashi Province (present-day Tomida, Honjo City, Saitama Prefecture) during the Kamakura Period.
Chikayuki TOMIDA was a samurai who belonged to the Kodama party of Musashi Province (present-day Tomida, Honjo City, Saitama Prefecture) during the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 用語リストの表記に従い、Kamakura Period を Kamakura period に変更しました。
sen.e: Chikayuki TOMIDA was a samurai who belonged to the Kodama party of Musashi Province (present-day Tomida, Honjo City, Saitama Prefecture) during the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 児玉党系富田氏の3代目。
sen.e: Chikayuki was the third family head of the TOMIDA clan, one of the Kodama Party.
Chikayuki was the third family head of the Tomida clan belonging to the Kodama Party.
sen.cmt: TOMIDA clan を Tomida clan に変更し、また、「児玉党系」の英訳を belonging to the Kodama Party に変更しました。
sen.e: Chikayuki was the third family head of the Tomida clan belonging to the Kodama Party.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: His common name was Kotaro.
He was commonly called Kotaro.
sen.cmt: 用語リスト等の表記にあわせ、変更しました。
sen.e: He was commonly called Kotaro.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 富田小太郎近行は、児玉党系富田氏の2代目である富田近重の嫡男として生まれた児玉党の武士である（祖父は富田親家）。
sen.e: Chikayuki Kotaro TOMIDA was a samurai of the Kodama Party who was born as a legitimate son of Chikashige TOMIDA, the second family head of TOMIDA clan of the Kodama Party (his grandfather was Chikaie TOMIDA).

Chikayuki Kotaro TOMIDA was a samurai of the Kodama Party who was born as a legitimate son of Chikashige TOMIDA, the second family head of the Tomida clan belonging to the Kodama Party (his grandfather was Chikaie TOMIDA).
sen.cmt: TOMIDA clan を Tomida clan に変更し、また、「児玉党系」の英訳を belonging to the Kodama Party に変更しました。
sen.e: Chikayuki Kotaro TOMIDA was a samurai of the Kodama Party who was born as a legitimate son of Chikashige TOMIDA, the second family head of the Tomida clan belonging to the Kodama Party (his grandfather was Chikaie TOMIDA).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 生まれは児玉郡富田村の富田氏館（現在の西富田堀の内）と考えられる。
sen.e: It is believed that Chikayuki was born in the TOMIDA Residence of Tomida Village, Kodama County, Musashi Province (present-day Horinouchi, Nishitomida).
Chikayuki is considered to have been born in the residence of the Tomida clan at Tomida Village, Kodama County, Musashi Province (present-day Horinouchi, Nishitomida).
sen.cmt: 「富田氏」を "Tomida clan"と表記しており、また、用語集にて「源氏館」を"Genji yakata (residence of the Minamoto clan)"と表記しているので、これを参考にし、「富田氏館」の英訳を変更しました。
sen.e: Chikayuki is considered to have been born in the residence of the Tomida clan at Tomida Village, Kodama County, Musashi Province (present-day Horinouchi, Nishitomida).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: His son was Chikauji TOMIDA.
sen.cmt: 富田親氏：読み方不明です。
sen.e: His son was Chikauji TOMIDA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: His son was Chikauji TOMIDA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 承久3年（1221年）の承久の乱で父近重と共に鎌倉幕府（北条泰時）軍に従い、宇治川の合戦で敵を1人討ち取る功績をあげたと『吾妻鏡』に記載されている。
sen.e: According to "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East, a chronicle of the early history of the Kamakura Bakufu), Chikayuki joined the army (headed by Yasutoki HOJO) of the Kamakura Bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) with his father, Chikayuki, and had an achievement of killing one enemy in the Battle of Uji River, one of the battles during the Jokyu War of 1221.

According to "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East, a chronicle of the early history of the Kamakura Bakufu), Chikayuki joined the Kamakura bakufu army (headed by Yasutoki HOJO) with his father, Chikayuki, and rendered distinguished service of killing one enemy in the Battle of Uji-gawa River, one of the battles during the Jokyu War of 1221.
sen.cmt: 用語集等を参照し、「鎌倉幕府軍」及び「宇治川の戦い」の表記を変更しました。
sen.e: According to "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East, a chronicle of the early history of the Kamakura Bakufu), Chikayuki joined the Kamakura bakufu army (headed by Yasutoki HOJO) with his father, Chikayuki, and rendered distinguished service of killing one enemy in the Battle of Uji-gawa River, one of the battles during the Jokyu War of 1221.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 祖父の近家は和田合戦（1213年）の時、和田氏軍に味方し、北条氏軍と戦って捕らえられた。
sen.e: In the Battle of WADA (1213), Chikayuki's father, Chikaie, who took side of the army of the WADA-clan, fought against the army of the HOJO clan and got captured.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the Battle of WADA (1213), Chikayuki's grandfather, Chikaie, who took the side of the army of the Wada clan, fought against the army of the Hojo clan and got captured.
sen.cmt: 「祖父」の誤訳を訂正し、「和田氏」および「北条氏」の表記を、それぞれ用語集に記載された表記に変更しました。
sen.e: In the Battle of WADA (1213), Chikayuki's grandfather, Chikaie, who took the side of the army of the Wada clan, fought against the army of the Hojo clan and got captured.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし、その怪力＝力芸を将軍家にみせたところ、その罪を許され、所領を与えられた。
sen.e: However, Chikaie was finally given amnesty and territories by the shogun family by giving a performance using his herculean power.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, when giving a performance using his herculean power, Chikaie was finally granted amnesty and territories by the Shogun family.
sen.cmt: 「罪を許す」に amnesty を使っているので、動詞を granted に変更し、また、by the Shogun family by giving ～ と "by" が重なるので、by giving ～を文頭に置き、「～ところ」の訳を 原文に即し、when に変更しました。
sen.e: However, when giving a performance using his herculean power, Chikaie was finally granted amnesty and territories by the Shogun family.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: これに深い恩義を感じた児玉党系富田氏は、以降、忠義を尽くす事となる。
sen.e: Feeling deep obligation, the TOMIDA clan of the Kodama Party had served as a faithful servant of the shogun family since then.
Deeply feeling indebted to the Shogun family for this favor, the TOMIDA clan belonging to the Kodama Party had served as a faithful servant since then.
sen.cmt: Eijiro より、「恩義を感じる」を feel indebted to someone for ～ に変更しました。
sen.e: Deeply feeling indebted to the Shogun family for this favor, the TOMIDA clan belonging to the Kodama Party had served as a faithful servant since then.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
